title: Flipped Learning-Based Deep Learning Competency Development Course in Social Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Social Science Knowledge and Digital Learning Tool Proficiency
context.additional_context: For active practitioners, emphasizing deep analysis and collaborative competencies for solving social issues.

learning_goals: Learners complete over 80% of pre-learning materials in a flipped learning environment and actively engage in discussions and project activities
Learners execute social issue-solving projects using a four-stage flipped learning model (pre-learning → active learning → concept application → reflection)

Learners demonstrate deep learning competencies improved by over 20% in cognitive (analysis/synthesis), interpersonal (collaboration/communication), and intrapersonal (metacognition/self-regulation) domains

resources: Mobile-Optimized Learning Platform (Rain Classroom Model Applied)
Open-Source Dataset for Social Issue Resolution
Collaborative Tools (Smartphone-Compatible Online Whiteboard/Document Sharing System)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
